cab.content: SEC R F T G.T.-117WAR CABINETPARAPHRASE OF TELEGRAM FROM SIR C. MARLING (TEHERAN)March 5th 191?.Notwithstanding adverse opinion of Sykes1 powers as an organiser, mentioned, in telegram from India, it would seem advisable that the Officer .*ho is tc form South Persian Rifles should be under Sykes, because the organisation should be uniform; because it is undesirable to use police in localities where they have been recruited-. Units can be moved from one district to another v. hen there is one single command; because the Seistan quota will be. ultimately embodied in South Persian Rifles and because only one command will be recognised by the Persian Government.
